page.title: 11Abandoned Railway Lines
page.content: The Barnard Castle-Kirkby Stephen railway line,originally owned by the Sth.Durham and Lancashire Union,was opened in{July,1861,}for transporting minerals.It was closed in{November, {1964,}and dismantled soon afterward. The section which runs through this area is divided between a cutting and an embankment.There are also two spurs which used to serve the quarries. The closure of the railway led to the loss of jobs,not only for those people employed on the railway,but also for workers from the nearby quarries.In addition,it closed a cross-Pennine route which often stayed open during the winter when the A66 trunk road became impassable. Apart from the road bridge on the A67 (Barnard Castle to Bowes) which spans the cutting and an odd red-brick pump- house,there is now little left to see.
